item-identification.title: Fall Bottom Trawl Survey
item-identification.abstract: The standardized NEFSC Fall Bottom Trawl Survey was initiated in 1963 and covered an area from Hudson Canyon, NY to Nova Scotia, Canada. Throughout the years, coverage has extended as far south as Florida and sampling depths have ranged from <27 to 366 m. Currently, the survey coverage is from Cape Hatteras, NC to Nova Scotia and the minimum depth range is > 18 m as the result of a change in the sampling platform. This has resulted in the exclusion of many inshore strata.
item-identification.purpose: The purpose of the Fall Bottom Trawl Survey is to determine the seasonal distribution, relative abundance, and biodiversity of fish and invertebrate species found on the continental shelf during the fall months, typically September to November. Other cruise objectives are: to collect biological samples for age determinations and growth sutidies, fecundity, maturity, and feeding ecology; opportunistically test trawl gear, methods, or survey-related equipment that may benefit the trawl survey in the future; collect oceanographic data, inclduing CTD casts as well as samples of ichthyoplankton and zooplankton for relative abundance and distribution studies; and to collect hydroacoustic data between stations. Fishery scientists use the data to assess 45 stocks of commercial and recreational fish and invertebrate species in the northeastern United States.

data-set-information.maintenance-note: The time series for the Fall Bottom Trawl Survey began in 1963 with data collection and quality assurance occurring with both paper and digital methods throughout the time series. Data consumers occasionally find questionable data from earlier paper collected data that requires verification via the original paper log. The frequency for such verification is minimal.
data-set-information.entity-attribute-overview: The provided Fall Bottom Trawl Survey time series from 1963 - most recently audited data set (2018) contain standard audited raw survey results without adjustments for changes in gear and/or vessel over the length of the time series. All "good" tows are included in these data sets. Additional non-representative tows are available upon request only. All inquiries for obtaining calibration information for vessel and gear changes should be addressed to the Chief of the Population Dynamics Branch or Chief of the Resource Evaluation and Assessment Division of the Northeast Fisheries Science Center (NEFSC). The provided data sets contain the following information: Station Data - Vessel-related information (e.g., cruise ID, location, speed, course, etc.) and surface and bottom sea water temperature and salinity Aggregate Species Data - Tow-by-tow total weight and number of each species. Species Length Frequencies - Summarized number of fish measured at each length interval Individual Fish Data - Additional parameters collected from individual fish (other than length): sex, individual weight, gonad maturation, age, and overall volume of stomach contents.
data-set-information.instrument: bottom trawl, bongo nets, CTD, SCS, net mensuration sensors
data-set-information.platform: FRV Albatross IV, FRV Delaware II, and FRV Henry B. Bigelow

data-attribute.name: CLOUD
data-attribute.description: Code to represent percentage of cloud cover. See SVDBS.CLOUD

data-attribute.name: PCTCLEAR
data-attribute.description: Cloud cover as a percentage. See SVDBS.CLOUD

data-attribute.name: DOE
data-attribute.description: Date when record was inserted into Oracle. Date format (MM/DD/YY HH:MI:SS).

data-attribute.name: DOC
data-attribute.description: Date when the current record was updated or changed. Date format (MM/DD/YY HH:MI:SS)

data-attribute.name: UOE
data-attribute.description: The Oracle username of the individual who entered the new record.

data-attribute.name: UOC
data-attribute.description: The Oracle username of the individual who changed the current record.

entity.title: Table: MATURITY_CODES
entity.abstract: Historical support table containing acceptable maturity codes and their description. FSCS_MATURITY_CODES replaces this table.

entity-information.description: Historical support table containing acceptable maturity codes and their description. FSCS_MATURITY_CODES replaces this table.

data-attribute.name: MATURITY
data-attribute.description: Stage of maturation of the fish being sampled. See SVDBS.FSCS_MATURITY_CODES

data-attribute.name: MATURITY_DESCRIPTION
data-attribute.description: Description of maturity codes.

entity.title: Table: SEX_CODES
entity.abstract: Historical support table containing acceptable codes and descriptions for the field sex.

entity-information.description: Historical support table containing acceptable codes and descriptions for the field sex.

data-attribute.name: SEX
data-attribute.description: Code indicating sex of fish or invertebrate species. See SVDBS.FSCS_SEX_CODES if using fscs data and SVDBS.SEX_CODES if using non FSCS data. Codes 0, 1, 2 and 4 are the only valid codes in fscs tables.

data-attribute.name: SEX_DESCRIPTION
data-attribute.description: Description of the sex code field. Only 0, 1, 2 are valid entries for fscs tables. 0=Unsexed, unknown, or sex not observed; Since the summer 1995 Gulf of Maine Trawl Survey forgot to look for American Lobster; 1=Male; 2=Female; Female Stage I for Northern Shrimp; Since the summer 1995 Gulf of Maine Trawl Survey Female (no eggs, no notch) for American Lobster; 3=Female Stage II for Northern Shrimp; Since the summer 1995 Gulf of Maine Trawl Survey Female, with eggs, no notch for American Lobster; 4=Transitional for Northern Shrimp; Since the summer 1995 Gulf of Maine Trawl Survey Female, with notch, no eggs for American Lobster; 5=Ovigerous for Northern Shrimp; Since the summer 1995 Gulf of Maine Trawl Survey Female, with notch and eggs for American Lobster;6=Non-spawning Female for Northern Shrimp; 7=Female for Northern Shrimp not staged (stage I or II not determined)

entity.title: Table: SVMSTRATA
entity.abstract: Historical support table containing all acceptable stratum codes.

entity-information.description: Historical support table containing all acceptable stratum codes.

data-attribute.name: STRGRP_DESC
data-attribute.description: Description of stratum group.

data-attribute.name: STRATUM
data-attribute.description: A predefined area where a net dredge, or other piece of gear was deployed. Code consists of 2 parts: Stratum group code number (2 bytes) and stratum number (3 bytes). Stratum group refers to if area fished is inshore or offshore North or South of Cape Hatteras or the type of cruise (shellfish, State of MA, offshore deepwater). The stratum number (third and fourth digits of code) refers to area defined by depth zone. See SVDBS.SVMSTRATA. The fifth digit of the code increases the length of the stratum number for revised strata after the Hague Line was established. Stratum group code: 01 = Trawl, offshore north of Hatteras; 02 = BIOM; 03 = Trawl, inshore north of Hatteras; 04 = Shrimp; 05 = Scotian shelf; 06 = Shellfish; 07 = Trawl, inshore south of Hatteras; 08 = Trawl, Offshore south of Hatteras; 09 = MA DMF; 99 = Offshore deepwater (outside the stratified area). A change in Bottom Trawl Stratum for the Gulf of Maine-Bay of Fundy has been in effect since Spring 1987, and may be summarized as follows: Previous strata: 01350; Present strata: 01351, 01352.

data-attribute.name: STRATUM_NAME
data-attribute.description: Name of stratum area.

data-attribute.name: STRATUM_AREA
data-attribute.description: Stratum area measured in square nautical miles.

data-attribute.name: MIDLAT
data-attribute.description: Middle latitude in stratum for auditing purposes.

data-attribute.name: MIDLON
data-attribute.description: Middle longitude in stratum for auditing purposes.

data-attribute.name: MINLAT
data-attribute.description: Minimum latitude in stratum for auditing purposes.

data-attribute.name: MAXLAT
data-attribute.description: Maximum latitude in stratum for auditing purposes.

data-attribute.name: MINLON
data-attribute.description: Minimum longitude in stratum for auditing purposes.

data-attribute.name: MAXLON
data-attribute.description: Maximum longitude in stratum for auditing purposes.

data-attribute.name: BLOCKS
data-attribute.description: Statistical area blocks.

data-attribute.name: NOTOWS
data-attribute.description: Number of tows for a given stratum.

data-attribute.name: DOE
data-attribute.description: Date when record was inserted into Oracle. Date format (MM/DD/YY HH:MI:SS).

data-attribute.name: DOC
data-attribute.description: Date when the current record was updated or changed. Date format (MM/DD/YY HH:MI:SS)

data-attribute.name: UOE
data-attribute.description: The Oracle username of the individual who entered the new record.

data-attribute.name: UOC
data-attribute.description: The Oracle username of the individual who changed the current record.

entity.title: Table: SVVESSEL
entity.abstract: Support table identifying all vessel codes and descriptions.

entity-information.description: Support table identifying all vessel codes and descriptions.

data-attribute.name: VESSEL_NAME
data-attribute.description: Name of vessel.

data-attribute.name: VESSEL_ABBREV
data-attribute.description: Vessel abbreviation. See SVDBS.SV_VESSEL

data-attribute.name: COUNTRY_OF_ORIGIN
data-attribute.description: Country of origin of vessel.

data-attribute.name: HOME_PORT
data-attribute.description: City where vessel maintains its home port.

data-attribute.name: AGENCY_NAME
data-attribute.description: Name of state or federal agency that utilizes the vessel.

data-attribute.name: LENGTH_OVERALL_FT
data-attribute.description: Overall length of vessel measured to nearest foot.

data-attribute.name: CONSTRUCTION
data-attribute.description: Construction material of vessel.

data-attribute.name: YEAR_BUILT
data-attribute.description: Year vessel was built.

entity.title: Table: UNION_FSCS_SVBIO
entity.abstract: Materialized view joining pre-FSCS and FSCS data sets into one structure. Contains individual fish and invertebrate data.

entity-information.description: Materialized view joining pre-FSCS and FSCS data sets into one structure. Contains individual fish and invertebrate data.

data-attribute.name: CRUISE6
data-attribute.description: Code uniquely identifying cruise. The first four digits indicate the year and the last two digit uniquely identify the cruise within the year. The 5th byte signifies cruises other than groundfish: Shrimp survey = 7 (i.e. 201470), State of Massachusetts survey = 9 (i.e. 201491), Food habits = 5 (i.e.199554)

data-attribute.name: CRUISE
data-attribute.description: Unique numerical code for a cruise.

data-attribute.name: STRATUM
data-attribute.description: A predefined area where a net dredge, or other piece of gear was deployed. Code consists of 2 parts: Stratum group code number (2 bytes) and stratum number (3 bytes). Stratum group refers to if area fished is inshore or offshore North or South of Cape Hatteras or the type of cruise (shellfish, State of MA, offshore deepwater). The stratum number (third and fourth digits of code) refers to area defined by depth zone. See SVDBS.SVMSTRATA. The fifth digit of the code increases the length of the stratum number for revised strata after the Hague Line was established. Stratum group code: 01 = Trawl, offshore north of Hatteras; 02 = BIOM; 03 = Trawl, inshore north of Hatteras; 04 = Shrimp; 05 = Scotian shelf; 06 = Shellfish; 07 = Trawl, inshore south of Hatteras; 08 = Trawl, Offshore south of Hatteras; 09 = MA DMF; 99 = Offshore deepwater (outside the stratified area). A change in Bottom Trawl Stratum for the Gulf of Maine-Bay of Fundy has been in effect since Spring 1987, and may be summarized as follows: Previous strata: 01350; Present strata: 01351, 01352.

data-attribute.name: TOW
data-attribute.description: Sequential number representing order in which station was selected within a stratum.

data-attribute.name: STATION
data-attribute.description: Unique sequential order in which stations have been completed. Hangups and short tows each receive a non-repeated consecutive number.

data-attribute.name: STATUS_CODE
data-attribute.description: Code referencing whether or not a cruise is available in the SVDBS system. See SVDBS.SVCRUISE_STATUS.

data-attribute.name: ID
data-attribute.description: Concatenation of Cruise, Stratum, Tow and Station values.

data-attribute.name: SVSPP
data-attribute.description: A standard code which represents a species caught in a trawl or dredge. Refer to the SVDBS.SVSPECIES_LIST

data-attribute.name: CATCHSEX
data-attribute.description: Code used to identify species that are sexed at the catch level. See SVDBS.SEX_CODES

data-attribute.name: INDID
data-attribute.description: A unique identifier for each fish sampled.

data-attribute.name: LENGTH
data-attribute.description: Measured length of species in centimeters (cm). Measure method differs by species.

data-attribute.name: INDWT
data-attribute.description: Individual weight (KG) of species being sampled.

data-attribute.name: SEX
data-attribute.description: Code indicating sex of fish or invertebrate species. See SVDBS.FSCS_SEX_CODES if using fscs data and SVDBS.SEX_CODES if using non FSCS data. Codes 0, 1, 2 and 4 are the only valid codes in fscs tables.

data-attribute.name: MATURITY
data-attribute.description: Stage of maturation of the fish being sampled. See SVDBS.FSCS_MATURITY_CODES

data-attribute.name: AGE
data-attribute.description: Age of specimen in years.

data-attribute.name: AGE_DATA_FLAG
data-attribute.description: Code to indicate whether or not an age sample was taken. Valuess: Y = Yes, sample taken; NULL = no age sample taken.

data-attribute.name: STOM_VOLUME
data-attribute.description: Volume of the stomach contents of the fish sampled, measured to the nearest tenth of a cubic centimeter (cc).

data-attribute.name: STOM_WGT
data-attribute.description: Stomach weight of an individual fish in grams.

data-attribute.name: CUTTER
data-attribute.description: Name of the individual who was measuring and cutting fish at a FSCS workstation.

data-attribute.name: RECORDER
data-attribute.description: The name of the individual who recorded data.

data-attribute.name: IND_FISH_COMMENTS
data-attribute.description: Comment field for an indiviual fish or invertebrate sampled.

entity.title: Table: UNION_FSCS_SVCAT
entity.abstract: Materialized view joining pre-FSCS and FSCS data sets into one structure. Contains total number and weight of all species caught at a station.

data-attribute.name: SVSPP
data-attribute.description: A standard code which represents a species caught in a trawl or dredge. Refer to the SVDBS.SVSPECIES_LIST

data-attribute.name: CATCHSEX
data-attribute.description: Code used to identify species that are sexed at the catch level. See SVDBS.SEX_CODES

data-attribute.name: EXPCATCHNUM
data-attribute.description: Expanded number of individuals of a species caught at a given station.

data-attribute.name: EXPCATCHWT
data-attribute.description: Expanded catch weight of a species caught at a given station.

data-attribute.name: LOGGED_SPECIES_NAME
data-attribute.description: Name of the species, either common, scientific or both.

data-attribute.name: CATCH_COMMENT
data-attribute.description: Comments concerning a species at the catch level.

entity.title: Table: UNION_FSCS_SVSTA
entity.abstract: Materialized view joining pre-FSCS and FSCS data sets into one structure. Contains station data for each station.

data-attribute.name: ID
data-attribute.description: Concatenation of Cruise, Stratum, Tow and Station values.

data-attribute.name: AREA
data-attribute.description: Standard area code used for commercial data (New England Statistical Area Code) for the position of the beginning of the tow.

data-attribute.name: SVVESSEL
data-attribute.description: Standard two character code for a survey vessel. Refer to SVDBS.SV_VESSEL

data-attribute.name: CRUNUM
data-attribute.description: National Ocean Services (NOS) consecutive cruise number on a particular vessel.

data-attribute.name: SVGEAR
data-attribute.description: Code referencing predominant gear type used on a cruise. See SVDBS.SVGEAR table.

data-attribute.name: BEGIN_EST_TOWDATE
data-attribute.description: Date and time represented by Eastern Standard Time (EST) for the start of a tow or deployment.

data-attribute.name: END_EST_TOWDATE
data-attribute.description: Date and time represented by Eastern Standard Time (EST) at the end of a tow or deployment.

data-attribute.name: BEGIN_GMT_TOWDATE
data-attribute.description: Date and time represented by Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) for the start of a tow or deployment.

data-attribute.name: END_GMT_TOWDATE
data-attribute.description: Date and time represented by Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) at the end of a tow or deployment.

data-attribute.name: EST_YEAR
data-attribute.description: Year, represented by Eastern Standard Time (EST).

data-attribute.name: EST_MONTH
data-attribute.description: Month, represented by Eastern Standard Time (EST).

data-attribute.name: EST_DAY
data-attribute.description: Day of the month represented by Eastern Standard Time (EST).

data-attribute.name: EST_JULIAN_DAY
data-attribute.description: Julian day of towdate represented as Eastern Standard Time (EST).

data-attribute.name: EST_TIME
data-attribute.description: Time, represented by Eastern Standard Time (EST).

data-attribute.name: GMT_YEAR
data-attribute.description: Year, represented as Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

data-attribute.name: GMT_MONTH
data-attribute.description: Month, represented as Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

data-attribute.name: GMT_DAY
data-attribute.description: Day of the month, represented as Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

data-attribute.name: GMT_JULIAN_DAY
data-attribute.description: Julian day of towdate represented as Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

data-attribute.name: GMT_TIME
data-attribute.description: Time, represented as Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

data-attribute.name: TOWDUR
data-attribute.description: Duration of tow in minutes.

data-attribute.name: SETDEPTH
data-attribute.description: Depth at the time the primary gear is set to fish, to the nearest meter.

data-attribute.name: ENDDEPTH
data-attribute.description: Water depth (m) at end of tow.

data-attribute.name: MINDEPTH
data-attribute.description: Minimum depth (m) at which gear fished.

data-attribute.name: MAXDEPTH
data-attribute.description: Maximum depth at which gear fished.

data-attribute.name: AVGDEPTH
data-attribute.description: A four digit number recording the average depth, to the nearest meter, during a survey gear deployment.

data-attribute.name: BEGLAT
data-attribute.description: Beginning latitude of tow (decimal degrees).

data-attribute.name: BEGLON
data-attribute.description: Beginning longitude of tow (decimal degrees).

data-attribute.name: ENDLAT
data-attribute.description: Latitude at end of tow.

data-attribute.name: ENDLON
data-attribute.description: Logitude at end of tow.

data-attribute.name: DECDEG_BEGLAT
data-attribute.description: Beginning latitude of tow in decimal degrees.

data-attribute.name: DECDEG_BEGLON
data-attribute.description: Beginning longitude of tow in decimal degrees.

data-attribute.name: DECDEG_ENDLAT
data-attribute.description: Ending latitide of tow in decimal degrees.

data-attribute.name: DECDEG_ENDLON
data-attribute.description: Ending longitude of tow in decimal degrees.

data-attribute.name: CABLE
data-attribute.description: Wire out (meters) at the water surface.

data-attribute.name: PITCH
data-attribute.description: Pitch of variable pitch propeller.

data-attribute.name: HEADING
data-attribute.description: Vessel compass heading.

data-attribute.name: COURSE
data-attribute.description: Actual course the vessel made good in degrees.

data-attribute.name: RPM
data-attribute.description: Average shaft revolutions per minute while under tow.

data-attribute.name: DOPDISTB
data-attribute.description: Speed over bottom recorded by GPS.

data-attribute.name: DOPDISTW
data-attribute.description: Speed through water recorded by AMATEK when the water depth is >200m.

data-attribute.name: DESSPEED
data-attribute.description: Designated towing speed for a particular gear (knots).

data-attribute.name: OTHGEAR
data-attribute.description: Code for gear deployed other than primary gear (i.e. net, dredge) such as bongo, Neuston, etc. See SVDBS.OTHGEAR

data-attribute.name: AIRTEMP
data-attribute.description: Air temperature (degrees Celsius) rounded to nearest whole degree.

data-attribute.name: CLOUD
data-attribute.description: Code to represent percentage of cloud cover. See SVDBS.CLOUD

data-attribute.name: BAROPRESS
data-attribute.description: Barometric pressure (millibars).

data-attribute.name: WINDDIR
data-attribute.description: Direction of wind during deployment of gear (degrees).

data-attribute.name: WINDSP
data-attribute.description: Speed of wind in knots.

data-attribute.name: WEATHER
data-attribute.description: Code reflecting weather condition. See SVDBS.WEATHER table

data-attribute.name: WAVEHGT
data-attribute.description: Height of waves (m).

data-attribute.name: SWELLDIR
data-attribute.description: Swell direction (degrees).

data-attribute.name: SWELLHGT
data-attribute.description: Swell height (m).

data-attribute.name: BKTTEMP
data-attribute.description: Surface water temperature (degrees Celsius).

data-attribute.name: TRASHAMT
data-attribute.description: Volume of trash in liters.

data-attribute.name: TRASHSHL
data-attribute.description: Trash by % of shells collected during shellfish surveys.

data-attribute.name: TRASHBIO
data-attribute.description: Trash by % of living animals such as fish, starfish and snails colected during shellfish surveys.

data-attribute.name: TRASHSUB
data-attribute.description: Trash by % of rocks, pebbles, sand collected during shellfish surveys.

data-attribute.name: XBT
data-attribute.description: Code associated with expendable bathythermograph (temperature/depth profile instrument). See SVDBS.XBT

data-attribute.name: SURFTEMP
data-attribute.description: Surface temperature of water (degrees Celcius).

data-attribute.name: SURFSALIN
data-attribute.description: Salinity at water surface in practical salinity units (PSU).

data-attribute.name: BOTTEMP
data-attribute.description: Bottom temperature (degrees Celsius).

data-attribute.name: BOTSALIN
data-attribute.description: Bottom salinity in Practical Salinity Units (PSU).

data-attribute.name: FULD
data-attribute.description: Fullness of the dredge, measured to the nearest bushel (used on scallop and clam surveys only).

data-attribute.name: NO_DETAIL_SVSPP
data-attribute.description: Number of biological data sheets associated with a given station.

data-attribute.name: BOTSPEED
data-attribute.description: Speed over bottom (knots) recorded by GPS.

data-attribute.name: WATCH_CHIEF
data-attribute.description: Person responsible for smooth conduct of each watch and the collection of data.

data-attribute.name: CHIEF_SCIENTIST
data-attribute.description: Person responsible for scientific operations (how and where sampling occurs) and the scientific party.

data-attribute.name: WATCH_CHIEF_COMMENTS
data-attribute.description: Watch Chief comment regarding current tow.

data-attribute.name: STATION_COMMENTS
data-attribute.description: Comment from the bridge officers.

data-attribute.name: HABITAT_COMMENTS
data-attribute.description: Comments on non-coded species found in catch.

geographic-area.description: northwest Atlantic: Cape Hatteras, NC to Nova Scotia

time-frame.description: The standardized Fall Bottom Trawl Survey began with the first station on November 14,1963 at 12:14 AM (GMT).

access-information.data-access-procedure: 1. Formal request in writing usually to the data owner/contact or Center Director. 2. Requester is contacted by data owner to review and verify the request content and details for data delivery options. 3. If data is confidential then owner will determine is the data may be released to the requester. 4. If data can be released, the data is downloaded and packaged for delivery electronically; or the requester may be directed to where the data is available online.
access-information.data-access-constraints: If data is stored on an internal NEFSC network, the requester may not have direct access to query the data unless they are also authorized for network access.
access-information.data-use-constraints: User must read and fully comprehend the metadata prior to use. Applications or inferences derived from the data should be carefully considered for accuracy. Acknowledgement of NOAA/NMFS/NEFSC, as the source from which these data were obtained in any publications and/or other representations of these, data is suggested.

distribution.description:
Compressed Zipped Folders 22560_FSCSTables.zip contains Entities - 22560_UNION_FSCS_SVBIO.csv - 22560_UNION_FSCS_SVCAT.csv - 22560_UNION_FSCS_SVLEN.csv - 22560_UNION_FSCS_SVSTA.csv
Data extracted on 5/31/2019

Compressed Zipped Folder contains Support Table Entities for this data set SVDBS_SupportTables.zip contains Entities - SVDBS_CLOUD.csv - SVDBS_MATURITY_CODES.csv - SVDBS_SEX_CODES.csv - SVDBS_SVGEAR.csv - SVDBS_SVMSTRATA.csv - SVDBS_SVVESSEL.csv - SVDBS_WEATHER.csv - SVDBS_XBT.csv
Data extracted on 8/8/2017

url.description: Link to Survey Cruise Results. Cruise results describe the purpose, methods used, personnel who participated, and provides a summary of the total number of samples collected for various government and university investigators during the Ecosystem Surveys Branch's bottom trawl and shellfish surveys.

Link to the Resource Survey Reports. Each report consists of field notes, station and catch summaries, and a series of geographical plots of commercial and recreational important species caught during the Ecosystem Surveys Branch's bottom trawl and shellfish resource cruises.

data-quality.accuracy: High degree of accuracy. When there is species identification doubt at sea, the specimen is retained for taxonomy at the NEFSC or other taxonomic laboratory.
data-quality.quality-control-procedures: SCS and FSCS data collection software programs employ real-time validation and must meet database integrity constraints. Data are then subject to post-audits.

data-management.archive-location-explanation-none: Archiving solution for Oracle Data Sets is yet to be determined.
data-management.data-protection-plan: Archival of source data preserving unaltered collected data, Scheduled backups, Remote storage backups, Password protection.

lineage.lineage-statement: Vessel sensor data are collected electronically using SCS. Catch and biological data are collected electronically using FSCS 2.0. At the completion of each cruise leg, a database copy is inserted into the shoreside database.

faq.author: McHugh, Nancy
faq.question: What trawl gear was used during the spring surveys from 1963 - 1996?
faq.answer:
See Table 3b. of reference: NOAA Technical Memorandum NMFS-NE-122, Essential Fish Habitat Source Document: Fishery-Independent Surveys, Data Sources, and Methods. Robert N. Reid, Frank P. Almeida, and Christine A. Zetlin.
The #36 Yankee Trawl was used from 1963-1996 except in years 1972 and 1973 when the #36 Yankee was used and the 3/4 Yankee was used by the R/V Atlantic Twin.

faq.author: McHugh, Nancy
faq.question: Where can I find conversion coefficients for for species that had significantly different catch rates (in numbers) at the 0.05 level for each of the major gear changes in the survey?
faq.answer: See Table 4. of reference: NOAA Technical Memorandum NMFS-NE-122, Essential Fish Habitat Source Document: Fishery-Independent Surveys, Data Sources, and Methods. Robert N. Reid, Frank P. Almeida, and Christine A. Zetlin.
